knimeNode.name: Document Vector Hashing Applier
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a document vector for each document using a hash function.

fullDescription.intro: This node creates a document vector for each document representing it in the terms space. The values of the feature vectors will be boolean values or as values of either the relative frequency or the absolute frequency of the terms. This node needs a model input provided by the Document vector hashing node which contains the specifications for vector creation.
fullDescription.option: The column containing the documents to use.

If checked all vector entries will be stored in a collection cell consisting of double cells. If not checked all double cells will be stored in corresponding columns. The advantage of the column representation is that most of the regular algorithms in KNIME can be applied. The disadvantage is (which is on the other hand the advantage of the collection representation) that processing of subsequent nodes will be slowed down, due to the many columns that will be created (dependent on the input data of course).

ports.inPort: The model containing the settings to create the document vector space.
The input table containing the documents.
ports.outPort: An output table containing the input documents with the corresponding document vectors.
